value.title: Relationship in Power BI with Multiple Columns
value.excerpt: You can create relationships in Power BI between tables. Relationships are useful for some functions to work across multiple tables and produce the result. Relationship between tables also makes visualization and report elements more efficient, because the result of selection in one chart can affect

value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.title: Work with Power BI visuals
value.excerpt: Learn how to choose from the exceptional visuals that Power BI makes available to you. Formatting visuals will direct the user‚Äôs attention to exactly where you want it, while helping to make the visual easier to read and interpret. You will also learn about how to use key performance indicators (KPIs).

value.title: DAX Fridays! #78: When should I use FILTER() with CALCULATE?
value.excerpt: When should you use the filter function with CALCULATE?  As you probably have noticed, sometimes people use a column in the filter part of CALCULATE and sometimes they use the FILTER function.  The question is, when should you use what?  In this video I will try to clarify that question.  Dont miss part

value.title: Power BI Incremental Refresh and Hybrid Tables
value.excerpt: The default configuration for the Power BI dataset is to wipe out the entire data and reload it again. This can be a long process if you have a big dataset. Hybrid tables in Power BI keep part of the data in DirectQuery, and the rest is imported for data freshness and performance. In this video, I explain
